Reviews.Title: Great phone, pre-paid or not; can custamize
Reviews.Author: Justin "Good Times!!!"
Reviews.Content: This small phone is great as a great back-up or daily use phone.Pro's: if you play with the phone enough you can customize this phone quite a bit. As far as customizing the phone it is great everything from changing what the buttons do on the front to where the menu icons are located in the menu. ability to add music and other things through a sync cable that you can buy from amazon. BATTERY LIFE AND SIGNAL ARE ASTOUNDING! :) this phone is also quite loud. screen is plenty bright and i have not had a problem yet seeing it in any environment, i.e. sunshine/cloudy/indoor. etc.Note: if you have a phone contract with AT&T; already you CAN take you're sim card out of the current phone you have and put it into this phone; So long as all of you're numbers are saved to the sim card you are all set.there is actually 11.414 mb of hard memory in the phone as far as i can see, this is enough to add a few tones and some pictures for the background.Personally I do not use the "prepaid" service so i cannot comment on that subject.Con's: the buttons are a bit small, when it comes to texting they are a bit too small but when typing in a number or such under short-term use they are suitable. It comes with a limited selection of tones and extraneous features but that is deal-able. when accessing the menus and switching between menus there is a lag. there is no way to add an external memory chip.Note:Accessories it comes with: (1) alarm clock, calendar, to-do list, notes, calculator, timer, stopwatch, voice/sound recorder, you can sync and backup the data on the phone, i.e. contacts etc. has a speed dialing function. has T9 or text auto-complete. there are 6 different profiles that allow you to switch tones, ring volumes, and vibration.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Prepaid Phone.
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: I bought this while I am waiting for my Samsung Jack to arrive from Texas.Cons: There is some lag when going form one screen to another. When you press the center MENU button, you end up at the Media Mall. This icon should be changed to Messaging or Recent Calls. It is too easy to accidently end up on the internet and start spending your PrePaid balance. I had a hard time removing the back cover and had to take the phone to my AT&T; store for removal.Pros: The ringer is very loud. The keys are large and easy to press. The screen is fairly large and easy to read. The battery stays charged very well. Press the Call button and it brings up your recent calls made. I'm going to use this phone at work until the minutes expire in June. That will prevent wear and tear on my new Jack. Overall, this is a nice phone for $30.

Reviews.Title: Very good phone for price. Excellent Reception
Reviews.Author: Stephen W. Miller
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone as a backup and inevitably I broke my smartphone charging port. Usability can have minor issues, especially if you have large fingers as I do. Reception is excellent as is call quality. However slowness of the menu systems and other features which cannot be disabled, (At least I have not found them to be) confirmation tones on loud settings; and the check-mark after changing a setting or deleting a message. One other small issue the chrome ring encircling the screen and soft buttons is already starting to wear badly after only two weeks. If i had to pick two great features, and also reasons to buy this phone, they would be great battery life, and loudness of ringer. Great as a backup, but only that.

Reviews.Title: Simple, functional, cheap = 5 stars
Reviews.Author: Rona Gail Cho
Reviews.Content: My old Nokia flip phone just gave up on me (the LCD broke) and I was opting to buy a Nokia E63. I thought about it and realized that a smartphone would only be useless in my hands because I'm really not willing to pay for the monthly data usage/Internet fees. I also thought about getting the new iPhone 4G but I just bought an iTouch last month and I still have a year remaining in my contract with AT&T.; I browsed through all the unlocked and prepaid phones and I thought this  is the best choice. It's only $8 (without the go package) in AT&T;'s website and that totally sold me on this phone. It's not bad considering all I really do with my phone is text and call. I also don't need a phone which can play music and/or take pictures because I have an iPod and a digital camera which can take care of that already. It's sleek looking, it does what a phone should do and it's cheap.I just got this phone today (shipped from AT&T;) and it was better than what I expected. It's nice looking, it's thin and it works! I just put my old postpaid sim card on it and voila! If you're looking for simplicity, functionality and affordability, this is THE best phone you can get.

Reviews.Title: A Real Man's Phone Without the BS
Reviews.Author: Tony M.
Reviews.Content: Do you want a compact phone that makes reliable and clear calls without all the hassle?  This is the one.  If you want to spend all day stroking a sissy phone with finger gestures, dealing with bad service and plugging it in to every socket in sight,  go get a "smart" phone.  This Nokia does the job like MacGuyver--no excuses.  Face it, you're a man and you should have a real man's phone.  So man up!  Give that smart phone to your girlfriend.  Buy the Nokia 2320 now!

Reviews.Title: basic phone from Nokia 4.5
Reviews.Author: Jimbo Jones
Reviews.Content: I got this phone as a temporary replacement (replacing a jacked up LG Vu) I have had this phone since the afternoon you can access the web e mail send texts I haven't really delved into many of the features.  I like the bar form the phone is small and light I like the keypad lock feature which I also had on my other bar phone.  What I don't like the key to access the web is very easy to press by accident (no data plan) and that could prove costly (2 cents a second?) Themes and tones are limited but I found a nice background to use as well as a tone.  For a small phone its LOUD I had to turn it down a few bars.  its a basic phone for under $$ however I was told the phones started at $ which is under what the price is I paid for.  2 things why doesn't AT&T; offer go phones thtough their stores they need a better selection of phones for this range.  overall not bad a bad phone for making and receiving calls on.

Reviews.Title: Nice option
Reviews.Author: Gilberto Velarde
Reviews.Content: Traveling in FL & NC the coverage was good, and the pay as you go is a good plan if you only conect with AT&T; devices. Be carefull with the buttons if you press the wrong on probably a charge will be generated.

Reviews.Title: works just fine
Reviews.Author: H. Witte
Reviews.Content: I've had this phone a year now and it is still working fine.  My husband has the same one and he does not make as many calls as I do.  My battery was starting to last only like an hour (of talk time) before it needed to be charged again, so we switched batteries and now mine lasts at least 4 hours of talk time without any problem.  It is a very basic phone, not many free ring tone choices.

Reviews.Title: Good cell phone for real men
Reviews.Author: johnny q
Reviews.Content: If you're one of those who like to tweet or update your social network status, this phone is not for you.If you're a guy who needs a reliable, durable phone that doesn't have a hundred cute little features and buttons, with a battery life of more than a week, this is the phone for you.

Reviews.Title: Great basic phone
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have had this phone for six months and I love it. It is sturdy, lightweight and fits in my shirt pocket. It even has a ringtone that I can tolerate (Polaris). Battery life is excellent. Reception is excellent. Clarity is excellent. That's about it -- no frills, but you don't pay for them either. I bought this to replace my Motorola flip phone that got mulched by my riding lawn mower. Thankfully, the SIM survived (if a bit grass-stained). I pried off the back, popped in the SIM and I was back in the world of wireless. The $15 airtime credit was automatically converted to rollover minutes, and added to my existing AT&T; account.

Reviews.Title: My favorite phone
Reviews.Author: Krash "Krash"
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone 3 years ago.  It's been dropped, stepped on, you name it, and it just kept going.  It still works now, but just started losing speed dial assignments and won't let me reenter them.  The phone itself is pretty solid and not as flimsy as other prepaid phones.  The volume has a wide range and I can set it to where I can hear it well (I'm a little deaf).  Recorded audio comes out much louder and clearer than  other phones I've had.  Being a Nokia, you tend to get a wider range of service area than you get with others, as well.  It doesn't have a camera, but I have a small camera I carry in my purse anyway so I don't really need it.  I paid around $20 new for this and am a little disappointed that they've nearly doubled in price, but I guess the quality helped drive the price up.

Reviews.Title: Tuff to like an item that arrives inoperable
Reviews.Author: Phred "Phred"
Reviews.Content: This is the second Go Phone delivered to me - inoperable - this week.  The two phones were sold by different non Amazon sellers.In this instance there was no SIM card and no evidence of any pre-paid minutes. The customer service person at Amazon made a good faith effort to deal with the SIM card issue, but had nothing to say about the pre-paid minutes. So back it has gone while Amazon is honoring its refund policy.It is looking like some third (fourth?) party vendors are selling end of model runs without checking to see if these items had been scavenged, or previously returned.  Missing a SIM card means -does not work.I liked the design and features of this model. I have always owned Nokia phones and found them reliable and sturdy. I suspect that this version of the bar type cell phone is about to become extinct. I will miss them.

Reviews.Title: would not read my att sim card
Reviews.Author: Meghan
Reviews.Content: I charged the phone, put in my at&t; sim card but was unable to get it to allow me to make calls or send texts, it had my phone numbers but never got reception. Took it to at&t; store and they didn't know what the problem was either

Reviews.Title: The Best of the Basic
Reviews.Author: D. Sutor
Reviews.Content: This Phone gets 5 stars from me just because it blows anything else away in battery life.Careful,  similar models are battery hogs compared to this (nokia 2610) I think it has a capacitor problem and some may not experience what I have with drainage when powered off.Nokia has easy interface for basic task  and reminders, notes calendar which is a plus. This phone (after setting in calendar) reminds me to refill my minutes and money before I get penalties for not doing so from att go phone account. Small phone and lightweight. Easy to text with T-9 on.I don't like cell phone bills and this phone keeps costs low. I pay on average $10 a month at most.  I only use calls in emergencies which is like never but it's there if I need it. I get calls from friends that don't know how i use this phone and I just return the call when i get to my landline. Not worth explaining to every tom dick and rich harry friend.Friends eventually get the hint that I prefer text and that keeps costs down.  I don't set up voicemail on my line, that can only add to cost and deter friends from texting me which i prefer. It also keeps cold callers out of my life for the most part.  It's an Att go phone and they spam me through text more than anybody but all cell phone companies suck and you have to pick your poison.Con: no bluetooth or other high end phone pirks but at this cost what do you expect?

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my wife who destroys her phone often
Reviews.Author: Theodore Kirk "Theo"
Reviews.Content: My wife has a habit of losing, breaking, destroying, and damaging her phones. I finally found out that this Go Phone could replace your existing contract phone by inserting your activated SIM card into this phone. So each time she breaks her phone, I just get one of these! She's happy with it because it's simple and no frills. What do you expect for a $25 dollar phone? So I highly recommend it for this scenario.

Reviews.Title: Nokia 2320-GO Phone
Reviews.Author: Mark S. Mocarski "VideoFan"
Reviews.Content: Nice phone..great styling..activation(?)/I called AT&T..they; suggested I visit an AT&T; retail outlet for help/25-dollars for this phone is the best deal I have ever seen..ever..I had some problems removing the REAR-cover..it really is forced OFF--once the Button is applied fully--The Cell Phone was easy to set up..yet--is delivered without Activation..so I'll visit AT&T; tomorrow at the Mall.

Reviews.Title: This burner is righteous
Reviews.Author: Melissa Meade
Reviews.Content: Need a cheap phone for your illegal activity? I highly recommend this one. At $25 at the store the reception is excellent and the battery lasts over a week from one charge w/ minimal use. It doesn't have a camera, but in your business you don't want anyone taking pictures anyway.You could also use it for legal activities, such as replacing a more expensive phone until the your contract expires.

Reviews.Title: The "Included $15" is not easy to obtain or simply bogus
Reviews.Author: R. Man "R. Man"
Reviews.Content: I bougth this phone, activated it and tried to make a call.. system message says balance is too low to make calls.what about the included $15? nothing available anywhere in the package..they ask  you to buy airtime in order to make calls. But on the phone package in big bold letters.. "INCLUDED $15 AIRTIME"

Reviews.Title: goodphone
Reviews.Author: Claude Tarbell
Reviews.Content: Good working phone , ringer has good volume easy to hear persons on the other end , only down point is the over all size of the phone it's very easy to drop it when pulling it out to answer a call but a good emergency second phone.

Reviews.Title: oh yeahhh!!
Reviews.Author: Ryan Lobbig
Reviews.Content: Its not the smartest phone but it is the most reliable phone I have ever owned. If you need a burner phone to get you through a hard time, this is it.

Reviews.Title: Good basic phone
Reviews.Author: Bill B
Reviews.Content: This is my second Nokia 2320. I break phones and after going through 3 phones in six months, I switched to a simple go phone and transfered the sim card from my AT&T; phone. I have not been able to break the Nokia 2320 but I needed a new phone after 2 years because the plastic screen gets scratched and becomes difficult to read. I ordered the same phone and hope for another two years of use. This is a simple phone. It makes and receives phone calls and handles text messages. It will not work in Europe, as I found out, although most other AT&T; phones will work.

Reviews.Title: Meh.
Reviews.Author: Glacia
Reviews.Content: This phone is just OK.  It's overpriced for what it is . . . which is a disposable piece of junk . . . but it makes and receives calls.  back plate comes off easily which I don't like but the battery lasts forever.

Reviews.Title: Nokia 2320 Prepaid
Reviews.Author: adrea2134
Reviews.Content: The phone arrived extremely quick about 4 dates before the actual delivery.  My husband loves this phone, he is not into all of the fancy stuff so I purhcase him something plain and simple and he loves this phone.  The phone also came with a $15 prepaid card which helped out a lot. I would order from this seller again and again especially since the phone arrived before the due date and I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: Good first phone for kids
Reviews.Author: cesar
Reviews.Content: I didn't want to buy my brother an expensive phone  until I knew he wouldn't loose it. This phone is a great beginners phone since its cheap and can be easily replaced in case something does happen. Its a simple phone with easy navigation. Its mostly convenient for talking and texting. Dont expect to do anything fancy on this thing though.

Reviews.Title: Gophone service Mexico roaming does not deliever!
Reviews.Author: slivka
Reviews.Content: Bought Nokia 2320 gophone for roaming in Mexico.  At a cost of $15 at Bestbuy and with $15 credit and a promise of $0.25 per minute roaming it sounded very good.  But that's where the goodness ended.  The service was practically unusable in Mexico as it ate through $15 credit in a matter of a few calls.  Looking at calling history showed that I was charged for calls that never actually went through. On top of that adding all of the charges up amounted to $9 but somehow all of the $15 credit was gone.  After calling customer service, I got $6 back (15-9), but the money disappeared again as soon as I made a couple of short calls.  Not sure how gophone works in the States, but clearly there are major bugs as far as Mexico roaming goes.

Reviews.Title: AT&T; Prepaid Phones Suck!
Reviews.Author: debk
Reviews.Content: My elderly mom needs a cell phone for emergencies only.  So, we didn't need to complicate her life with refilling her phone every few months in order to keep the phone number active.  The AT&T; rep promised me via e-chat that you replace minutes only when you want or need to--the phone will never lose its phone number or service for lack of refilling on a regular basis.  So, I bought this phone for her because it was everything we were looking for.  The whole scenario changed when I activated the phone.  All the promises were GONE.  What it boiled down to was a phone that costs 25 cents a minute, must be refilled on a regular basis, and I found that my minutes were being chipped away while I was familiarizing myself with the phone!  This is something that the other prepaid carriers don't do.  I can't say enough good about Tracfone.  I've had Tracfone for several years, and they offer good value for your money.  AT&T; offered me NOTHING for the inconvience they caused me--weren't even willing to pay return shipping costs.  STAY AWAY FROM THEM -- THEY ARE EVIL LIARS!

Reviews.Title: Cell phone
Reviews.Author: Roy Harrington
Reviews.Content: I like it because I don't have to put the phone to my mouth,just hold it to my ear and talk.

ProductInfo.Features:
Thin, stylish phone supports text and instant messaging, web browsing, and e-mail
Pay for just the minutes you use with no annual contract--easy refill via Internet or prepaid cards
Integrated hands-free speaker lets you converse while working; compact black frame and large, responsive keys
Up to 3.5 hours of talk time, up to 360 hours (15 days) of standby time; released in February, 2010
What's in the Box: handset, rechargeable battery, charger, operating instructions, GoPhone SIM card
ProductInfo.Name: Nokia 2320 Prepaid GoPhone, Black (AT&T)
